question.body: Which of these areas of the brain receives impulses associated with the olfactory sense?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The axons from the olfactory bulb project superior to this part of the brain.
Incorrect. Smell is the only sensory modality that does not make synaptic connections in the thalamus.
Incorrect. The primary olfactory cortex is part of the temporal lobe.
Correct. The limbic structures include parts of the diencephalon and hippocampus and amygdala.
Incorrect. The primary olfactory cortex is part of the temporal lobe.
